result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven G Starker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING January 22, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by DOC.  Court found the domestic abuse surcharge is applicable.  BAil from 15CM2541 to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Be supervised by the Mental Health Unit.  Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.

No contact with victim unless the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to No Violent contact.
May have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling.
Successfuly complete any other counseling  and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Pay all supervision fes as determined by DOC.

Participate in alcohol and drug asessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens. Maintain absolute sobriety other than prescribed medication, taken only as prescribed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven G Starker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven G Starker in court PRO SE.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

15RM033631  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/15/15

15RM036934  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08/08/15

Defendant Steven G Starker in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
.
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 18 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 1/22/16.
-Be supervised by the Mental Health Unit, Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety other than prescribed medication, taken only as prescribed.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail from 15CM2541 to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-DNA sample; pay the surcharge.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Steven G Starker in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

15RM036935  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08/08/15
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 08-12-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Steven G Starker not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of today's hearing and requests adjournment for further pre-trial conference.  No objection by the State.  Court orders case adjourned for further pre-trial conference in Branch 40.
Clerk:  jms
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.M. dob 3/27/1963.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Steven G Starker in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Steven G Starker in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Steven G Starker not in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7-17-2015 at 1:30pm
